subclassFeatures.name: Ur Domain
entries: Ur-Priests are scarcely clerics in the traditional sense; many even despise the gods. Rather than being granted divine magic and authority by a deity or powerful idea, clerics of the Ur Domain siphon off the energies granted by gods to divine spellcasters, using it for their own needs without giving even lip-service to any god. Ur-Priests can come from any walk of life, but the most dangerous are always ex-clerics and paladins who have abandoned their gods. They violently oppose religion in any form, and use their powers to weaken the gods and destroy their followers.

entries.name: Ur Domain Spells
entries: Starting at 1st level, when you prepare spells following a long rest, you can select one spell to prepare from any list of cleric domain spells, and it doesnâ€™t count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. This spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots. At 8th level, you may prepare 2 spells in this way, and at 17th level, you may prepare 3.

entries.name: Godhate
entries: At 1st level, you have advantage on saving throws against divine spells, which are spells cast by clerics, paladins, druids, rangers, celestials, and other sources the DM deems appropriate.

entries.name: Channel Divinity: Anti-Heal
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to invert positive energy auras around you.

As a bonus action, you create a 60-foot-radius aura centered on you for one minute or until you dismiss it using another bonus action. Within this aura, no creature can magically regain hit points. If a creature were to regain hit points, it instead must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking necrotic damage equal to the health it would have regained on a failed save.

entries.name: Siphon Spell
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can expend two spell slots of the same level to cast a spell as if you were using a single spell slot that is one level higher than the slots being expended.

entries.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

entries.name: Steal Magic
entries: By 17th level, you have learned to siphon magic from spellcasters just as you do with the gods. When targeted by a spell, you can use your reaction to learn and prepare the spell until you complete a long rest. The spell is considered a cleric spell for you, but does not count against the number of spells you can prepare.
You can only learn one spell in this fashion at a time. If you use this feature again, the spell you already learned is immediately forgotten.
